Topics in the Sociology of the Family
“Public and Private Families: An Introduction” by Andrew Cherlin
此课程以科学研究为依据，用专题形式向学生介绍美国和中国家庭社会学的研究成果。课程将涵盖社会学对生命历程中婚姻及家庭的研究和分析。
此课程将向学生介绍社会学家是怎样科学的研究婚姻与家庭生活的。讨论题目将包括择偶，夫妻权力及家务劳动的分配，婚姻调适，离婚，和再婚等。课程的范围将涉及美国和中国家庭的“公共”（社会）及“私密”（个人）性，重点强调家庭的多样化，家庭变迁和公共政策。课程将运用比较家庭社会学的理论和方法。
亚里士多德逻辑学两讲
了解亚里士多德逻辑学工作脉络，认识到其逻辑学工作是如何与其哲学思想相辅相成的，以及亚里士多德的逻辑学如何为西方哲学界自其以后对思维方式及科学方法的考察传统。亚里士多德作为逻辑学的鼻祖，在受到现代逻辑学挑战之后，如何还能于中获得哲学研究的进益。从而启发学生进一步去思考，我们在科学研究和逻辑学研究中回到古典的意义是什么。
讲座围绕亚里士多德的逻辑学展开两个方面的内容：（1）亚里士多德思想中的定义概念；（2）亚里士多德《分析篇》导论。

"The first seventeen years of the 21st century seem to be full of fear, violence and mutual distrust among peoples in the world, as is symbolized by the fact that the horrible terror attacks occurred on 11 September in the first year of the century, 2001. In contrast, during the last decade in the 20th century or about ten years after the end of the Cold War (1989-2000), a large majority of people in the world conceived an optimistic view that the world peace and firm international cooperation would continue for long. How, why and what major changes have happened in global politics since the beginning of the 21st century? And, how, by whom and what should be done in order to build a future desirable and feasible global society? Those are the main themes in this lecture course. More concretely, the following recent noticeable phenomena will be focused on:
(A) Aggravation of terrorism and a return to the age of fear
(B) Deepening globalization and the decline of the nation-state system
(C) Exposure of global issues (e.g., global climate change, accumulation and proliferation of nuclear weapons, ethnic conflicts, instability of world economy, massive hunger and poverty, illegal use of IT, increasing refugees and human rights violation, worldwide spread of new types of infectious diseases, etc.)
(D) Rage of populism combined with ethnocentric nationalism: a Trumpized world
(E) Rise of China to a global power Questions and comments would be welcome in and after class.
Debates over the topics in the lecture course will be sometimes formed in class. The students are encouraged to straightforwardly express their own opinions as much as possible, for, I believe, a frank exchange of different views with fellow students and a professor is essential to develop each student’s clear and original idea on international politics.
Above all, I hope to have a heated discussion with students from China and other countries on the following question which is relevant to the last topic (E):
Can the Chinese people come up to the great expectations the global society conceives towards them, to promote China to be a global leader near future and keep its leading status for a long time?"

Gender has been dramatically transformed in recent years. This course examines the cultural and structural contours of gender from a sociological perspective. We begin by developing a theoretical framework for studying gender, which includes examining gendered identities, interactions, and institutions. Thereafter, we explore gender as a cultural form with respect to race, sexuality, and embodiment. We then analyzegender across various social institutions (family, education, the workforce, etc.), and conclude by addressing gender and social change. Throughout, we attend to historical and cross-cultural (comparative) variations in gender.

"This course will explore the multiple perspectives of current Science issues in Education scholarship. Scientific knowledge exists within complex interactions between many dimensions of knowing. This includes, historical, societal, environmental, economical and so on. This workshop allows for exploration into science as a dynamic body of knowledgeimpacting the world, and the world impacting upon it. Engagement in this workshop will be a series of hands on activities, debates and critical thinking. The course will highlight the following topics:
a)？Inquiry Based Learning
b) Critical？Place Based Science？Education
c)？Community？Engagement with Science
d)？Environmental？& Sustainability Education
e)？Contemporary？issues in？Science or Socio-Scientific issues
g) Social media for knowledge dissemination
h) Culturally responsive pedagogy in science
i) STEM (All workshops can include basic info on？Photography or？Social Media for knowledge sharing)."

"This course focus on the changes in many societies on the globe today. Going from an industrial society to a knowledge based society. The course will illustrate the changes and the challenges with these changes and the need of new knowledge and new Human Resources in the labour market.It illustrates also the changes of the policies and the consequences for higher education institutions. Course programme/lectures
1.Introduction–learningin a globalsociety (2h)
2.Higher Education and Relation to the Labour Market (2h)
3.Changing Higher Education (2h)
4.Changing HigherEducationv(2h)
5.Organisation and Management of Human Resource Development (2h) 6.Example: European Educational policies(2h)
7.Example: European Educational policies(2h)
8.Summary and Conclusions: International Perspectives and Global Education(2h)"

This course gives introductory knowledge and basic skills in data science and big data analytics. The topics include data life cycle, data preparation and transformation, explorative/descriptive data analysis, predictive data analysis, popular classification and clustering algorithms, model evaluation methods, and broad social issues around data science, such as data privacy and security, reproducibility and bias in data analytics. Students will experience algorithmic thinking and analytical thinking through lectures, discussions, real-world case studies and hands-on exercises.

Governments and public organizations around the globe have increasingly come to rely on explicit measurements of results. In many cases, these measures are connected with incentives. In this course, we will study the various types of performance measures available in the public sector. This includes a review of new types of indicators from the realm of “big data.” We will compare and contrast the advantages and disadvantages of different measures. This includes a review of how such measures are received by the different stakeholders of public organizations. Next, we will study different types of incentives that can be linked to the achievement of performance measures. We will review their consequences and side effects. Throughout the course, we will draw on examples from several countries, especially the U.S. and the UK. The aim of the course is to equip students with a good, practical understanding of the trade-offs involved in improving the management of public organizations.
Human Resources: New Policies and Challenges in the Knowledge Society
Human Resources: New Policies and Challenges in the Knowledge Society

The course will deal with the main features of Ancient Epicureanism (whose main representatives are Epicurus and Lucretius) from its historical background (Democritus’ atomism) to late Epicureanism (Diogenes of Oinoanda). It will cover the three parts of the epicurean philosophy: physics (theory of atoms and explanation of movement, general conception of the universe), ethics and anthropology (virtue and happiness, pleasure as principle of action, science and emotions, politics, development of civilization and language) and theory of knowledge (criteria of truth, cognitive faculties, theory of inference and logic). This course aims also at a characterization of Epicureanismon the horizon of greek and roman philosophy.

《新概念Visual C++6.0教程》,王腾蛟等,北京科海集团公司,2001年5月
The New Concept of Visual C + +6.0 Tutorial,Wangtengjiao, Beijing Kehai Group Company Press,May.2001

Visual C++是一种面向对象的程序设计语言，它包含了迄今为止功能最强大的基于Windows应用程序框架的集成开发环境。本课程是为管理系本科生开设的一门课程，在C++语言课程的基础上介绍Visual C++。该课程主要内容：Visual C++6.0的产生与特点,Visual C++6.0程序编译与运行环境,Visual C++6.0程序设计基础,Visual C++6.0应用程序的基本结构,Visual C++6.0的类,Visual C++6.0的输入输出操作,ODBC使用实例。通过该课程的学习，使学生掌握VisualC++6.0语言的基本语句、语法、常用类和可视化编程方法，使学生达到能用VisualC++6.0完成在电子商务中常用的基本编程工作。

《ERP 综合实验》课程是将ERP 理论知识的学习贯穿始终，通过沙盘模拟对抗演练——ERP 理论学习——企业行为模拟——ERP 管理软件应用等多种形式，将学生置身于企业的虚拟环境之中，模拟企业的主要运作过程，让学生了解、认识企业复杂多变的生存环境，熟悉企业的业务流程，亲自体验并模拟企业的团队建设、经营管理、经营决策、营销策略和企业之间的竞争与协作，在此基础上， 进一步要求学生能够借助ERP 软件实现模拟企业信息化管理，提高管理效率，提升模拟企业的管理水平。通过让学生参与企业的生产经营活动，制定各项经营决策，培养学生将理论知识与企业实际运作紧密联系的能力和发现问题、分析问题、解决问题、进行科学决策的能力，要求学生能够理解ERP 的管理理念和核心管理思想，达到学以致用的目的
《Visual c#.net 项目开发实战从入门到精通》，李继武，清华大学出版社，2007
Visual c#.net Actual Project Development From Entry to the Master,Lijiwu, Tsinghua University Press,2007

该课程是在继《电子商务技术基础》课程之后，针对Web的各种关键问题，讲授怎样应用《电子商务技术基础》所介绍的基本技术来解决Web各种关键问题的一般思路和通用算法，它是一种综合应用技能。本课程主要包括以下内容：用户接口设计、客户端信息获取、会话管理、数据访问、参数传递、用户跟踪、流量统计、时间处理、安全控制。本课程要求安排一边讲课一边上机操作，结合实际的学习方法。本实验课程具有鲜明的可操作性和理论联系实际的特点，通过本课程的学习可培养学生掌握Web应用开发能力。

安全工程是一门新兴的边缘学科，也是安全管理的重要内容。由于安全问题是社会共同关注的一个迫切问题，因此，本课程所介绍的基本理论和方法可广泛地应用于工业领域。本课程主要包括：事故发生原理、危险源辨识、危险性分析方法、危险性评价、危险源分级、控制与管理、固有危险源引起的事故、作业环境危险源及控制、人的操作可靠性及其失误的控制。该课程教学的目的是通过对该课程的学习，培养工业工程专业的学生在从事生产现场管理的工作中能够解决工业生产过程中的安全问题，保证生产过程的安全性。
《保险学》，孙褉祥，2005，北京大学出版社
保险学概论是金融学、财务、会计等专业的一门必修课，课内学时34课时，24学分。保险学概论主要研究和阐述保险学的最一般规律和基本理论，介绍保险的基本业务和基础知识。通过本课程的学习，既可以使学生明确保险学科的研究对象、掌握保险学的最基本概念、了解保险的基本业务，还可以完善学生的知识结构、开阔视野、提高学生从事经济工作的综合素质
